title: Daniel Sturridge limps off with ankle injury at Sunderland as Liverpool blow chance to close gap on Chelsea
text:
Sport Daniel Sturridge limps off with ankle injury at Sunderland as Liverpool blow chance to close gap on Chelsea The England striker opened the scoring at the Stadium of Light before being forced off late on, while James Milner was also withdrawn after suffering a knock to his calf Share Daniel Sturridge down after sustaining a injury (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Liverpool are sweating on the fitness of Daniel Sturridge after the striker limped off in the draw with Sunderland. 
Sturridge was making his first start since October at the Stadium of Light and opened the scoring for Jurgen Klopp's men with a fine header. 
But his afternoon ended on a sour note as he was forced off with 10 minutes to go. 
The England striker went down clutching his right ankle and Jurgen Klopp confirmed he had taken a knock. 
It is another blow for Sturridge , whose Anfield career has been severely hampered by injuries. Sturridge scores the opening goal (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Sturridge celebrates after scoring (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) 
James Milner was also withdrawn at the Stadium of Light as Alberto Moreno replaced him at the break. 
He suffered a knock to his calf and was removed as a precaution. 
Klopp went into the game without skipper Jordan Henderson, who has a heel problem. 
Liverpool are hopeful he will be fit to face Manchester United at Old Trafford later this month. Jurgen Klopp and James Milner (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Jermain Defoe celebrates scoring Sunderland's second goal (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Referee Anthony Taylor speaks to Jurgen Klopp (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
In his absence, Liverpool wasted the opportunity to close the gap on leaders Chelsea.
